tit.e: Yusoku Kojitsu (Ancient Court and Military Practices)

sen.j: 有職故実（ゆうそくこじつ）とは、古来からの先例に基づき、官職・儀式・装束などを研究すること。
sen.e: Yusoku kojitsu is to study job grades, ceremonies, and Shozoku (costumes) based on precedents from ancient times.
Yusoku kojitsu is the study of government positions, ceremonies, and costumes based on their ancient precedents.
Yusoku kojitsu is the study of government positions, ceremonies, and costumes based on their ancient precedents.

sen.j: 有識とは過去の先例に関する知識を指し、故実とは公私の行動の是非に関する説得力のある根拠・規範の類を指す。
sen.e: Yusoku means knowledge about past precedents; kojitsu means convincing basis and norms about right and wrong of public and private acts.
Yusoku' means a knowledge about past precedents, while 'kojitsu' means a convincing basis and norms for the rights and wrongs of public and private acts.

sen.j: そうした知識に通じた者を有識者（ゆうそくしゃ）と呼んだ。
sen.e: People who are very aware of such knowledge were called yusokusha.
People who are well versed in such knowledge were called yusokusha.
People who are well versed in such knowledge were called yusokusha.

sen.j: 後に転じて「有職」と呼ぶようになった。
sen.e: Later, it was turned to "Yusoku."
This later became "yusoku."
This later became "yusoku."

sen.j: なお今日、深い学識・見識を持つ人を「有識者（ゆうしきしゃ）」と呼ぶのはその名残である。
sen.e: Today, people with deep acquirements and wisdoms are called "Yushiki-sha," which is a legacy of this.
Today, people with deep knowledge and insight are called "yushiki-sha," which is a legacy of this.

tit.e: Kuge kojitsu (court rules of ceremony and etiquette)

sen.j: 平安時代の中期から、先例を伝える知識の体系化が進み、小野宮流、九条流の2つの流派が生まれた。
sen.e: Since the middle of the Heian Era, systematization of knowledge on precedents had advanced and two schools, the Ononomiya school and Kujo School were established.
The systematization of knowledge on precedents had advanced since the mid-Heian Era, and two schools, the Ononomiya School and Kujo School were established.
The systematization of knowledge on precedents had advanced since the mid-Heian Era, and two schools, the Ononomiya School and Kujo School were established.

sen.j: 遅れて小一条流が発生し、のちに九条流から御堂流が成立した。
sen.e: Then, the Koichijo school arose and the Mido School was established based on the Kujo school later.
sen.cmt: 用語集では小一条流は"Koichijo-ryu" となっていますが、他の流派にそろえて"Koichijo school" としました。
sen.e: The Koichijo School subsequently arose followed by the establishment of the Mido School branch of the Kujo school later.
The Koichijo School subsequently arose followed by the establishment of the Mido School branch of the Kujo school later.

sen.j: 院政期には源師頼を祖とする土御門流（村上源氏系）と源有仁を祖として縁戚の徳大寺実定・三条実房が完成させた花園流（閑院流系）もあったとされている。
sen.e: They say that there were also the Tsuchimikado School (Murakami-Genji (Minamoto clan) line) founded by MINAMOTO no Moroyori and the Hanazono School (the Kanin School line) founded by MINAMOTO no Arihito and perfected by his relatives Sanesada TOKUDAIJI and Sanefusa SANJO during insei period (during the period of the government by the retired Emperor).

It is thought that there was also the Tsuchimikado School (Murakami-Genji (Minamoto clan) line) founded by MINAMOTO no Moroyori and the Hanazono School (the Kanin School line) founded by MINAMOTO no Arihito and perfected by his relatives Sanesada TOKUDAIJI and Sanefusa SANJO during insei period (during the period of the government by the retired Emperor).

sen.j: 後に有職故実を司る徳大寺家（九条流）、大炊御門家（御堂流）が出た。
sen.e: Later, the Tokudaiji family (Kujo school) and the Oinomikado family (Mido School) who govern Yusoku kojitsu emerged.
The Tokudaiji family (Kujo school) and the Oinomikado family (Mido School) who governed Yusoku kojitsu subsequently emerged.

sen.j: 有職故実に関する原点は官製の儀式書に由来を求めることが出来るが、後に貴族は自己の日記に有職故実を書き残し、子孫が代々の日記を集成して有職故実書を編纂するようになった。
sen.e: While the origin of Yusoku kojitsu derives from government-regulated books on rites, nobility recorded Yusoku kojitsu on their diaries and their descendants aggregated ancestral diaries to compile Yusoku kojitsu.

While yusoku kojitsu originated from government-regulated books on rites, nobility recorded yusoku kojitsu in their diaries and their descendants collected ancestral diaries to compile yusoku kojitsu.

sen.j: 有職故実書の中でも、源高明の『西宮記』、藤原公任の『北山抄』、大江匡房の『江家次第』の三書は「後世の亀鑑」と仰がれ別格扱いであった。
sen.e: Among books on Yusoku kojitsu, three books "Saikyuki" written by MINAMOTO no Takaakira, "Hokuzansho" written by FUJIWARA no Kinto, and "Goke-shidai" written by OE no Masafusa were respected as 'kosei no kikan' (a paragon for the future generation) and treated as a special case.

sen.j: 室町時代の一条兼良はこの三書を、『西宮記』は古礼、『北山抄』は一条天皇の時代以降の儀式、『江家次第』は後三条天皇の時代以後の儀式と記している。
sen.e: Kaneyoshi ICHIJO, in Muromachi period, recorded about these three books as "Saikyuki" is about old ceremonial styles, "Hokuzansho" is about ceremonies in and after the era of Emperor Ichijo, and "Goke-shidai" is about ceremonies in and after the era of Emperor Gosanjo.

Kaneyoshi ICHIJO of the Muromachi period recorded that "Saikyuki" is about old ceremonial styles, "Hokuzansho" is about ceremonies during and after the era of Emperor Ichijo, and "Goke-shidai" is about ceremonies during and after the era of Emperor Gosanjo.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代以降、専門分化して、研究が盛んとなり、儀式については順徳天皇の『禁秘抄』、後醍醐天皇の『建武年中行事』、一条兼良の『公事根源』、官職制度については北畠親房の『職源抄』、服飾については源雅亮の『雅亮装束抄』などの有職故実書が著された。
sen.e: After the Kamakura period, Yusoku kojitsu was specialized and became an active area of research and Yusoku kojitsu books were written, among which "Kinpisho" written by Emperor Juntoku, "Kemmu Nenchu Ghoji" written by Emperor Godaigo, and "Kuji kongen" (the Rules of Court) written by Kaneyoshi ICHIJO were on ceremonies, "Shokugensho" written by Chikafusa KITABATAKE was on the government service system. and "Masasuke Shozoku Sho" (Masasuke's rule book on costumes) written by MINAMOTO no Masasuke was on clothing.

After the Kamakura period, yusoku kojitsu became as specialist field and the subject of active research, leading to the authorship of books including those on ceremonies such as "Kinpisho" written by Emperor Juntoku, "Kemmu Nenchu Ghoji" written by Emperor Godaigo, and "Kuji kongen" (the Rules of Court) written by Kaneyoshi ICHIJO; those on the government system such as "Shokugensho" written by Chikafusa KITABATAKE; and those on clothing such as "Masasuke Shozoku Sho" (Masasuke's rule book on costumes) written by MINAMOTO no Masasuke.

sen.j: また、著名な公家研究家として著名な人物としては南北朝時代 (日本)の洞院公賢・二条良基、室町時代の甘露寺親長、安土桃山時代・江戸時代初期の平田職忠などが挙げられる。
sen.e: Well-known Figures as researchers of famed kuge (court nobles) include Kinkata TOIN and Yoshimoto NIJO in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan), Chikanaga KANROJI in the Muromachi period, and Mototada HIRATA in the Azuchi-Momoyama period through to the early Edo period.

Well-known researchers of famous kuge (court nobles) include Kinkata TOIN and Yoshimoto NIJO in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan), Chikanaga KANROJI in the Muromachi period, and Mototada HIRATA in the Azuchi-Momoyama period through to the early Edo period.

tit.e: Buke-kojitsu (Regulations governing the customs of the buke class)
tit.cmt: 用語集の語 (Buke-kojitsu)を採用しました。

sen.j: 平安時代には、武人の故実（武官故実）は、紀氏と伴氏が伝えていたが、武士の台頭とともに衰えた。
sen.e: In the Heian period, kojitsu of warriors (Bukankojitsu) were passed down by the Ki and Tomo clans, but faded as the samurai class rose.
sen.cmt: 用語集の語 (Bukankojitsu)を採用しました。
sen.e: Kojitsu of warriors (Bukankojitsu) was passed down by the Ki and Tomo clans during the Heian period, but went into decline as the samurai class rose.
Kojitsu of warriors (Bukankojitsu) was passed down by the Ki and Tomo clans during the Heian period, but went into decline as the samurai class rose.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代には、源頼朝が故実に通じた武士を重んじ、故実の復元を図っている。
sen.e: In Kamakura period, MINAMOTO no Yoritomo highly regarded warriors who were very aware of kojitsu and tried to restore kojitsu.
In Kamakura period, MINAMOTO no Yoritomo highly regarded warriors who were very aware of kojitsu and tried to restore kojitsu.

sen.j: 以降、京都から断片的に流入した武官故実と関東在来の武士の慣習が合わさって、武家故実が体系化されていった。
sen.e: Since then, Bukankojitsu that flew in from Kyoto in fragments and traditional custom of warriors in the Kanto region were blended and systemized to create Buke-kojitsu (Regulations governing the customs of the buke class)

Subsequently, bukankojitsu introduced from Kyoto in piecemeal fashion and the traditional customs of warriors in the Kanto region were blended and systemized to create buke-kojitsu (military practices.)

sen.j: 武家故実の中でも弓馬や軍陣における実践的な故実と幕府や主君の前における儀礼や作法などの故実が存在したが、戦法の変化によって前者は形式的なものになったのに対して、後者は公家故実とも融合して、室町時代に小笠原流や伊勢流が生まれた。
sen.e: In Buke-kojitsu, there were practical kojitsu on Kyuba (archery and equestrianism) and wars and kojitsu on ceremonies and manners in bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and when in front of one's lord, and while the former became perfunctory due to change in tactics, the latter blended with kuge kojitsu and spawned the Ogasawara school and Ise school.

Within buke-kojitsu, there was practical kojitsu on kyuba (archery and horsemanship) and battle as well as kojitsu on ceremonies and manners for when in front of the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) or one's lord, and while the former became perfunctory due to changes in military tactics, the latter blended with kuge kojitsu and spawned the Ogasawara school and Ise school.

sen.j: 江戸時代以後、古典研究の発展に伴って民間でも有職故実の研究をする者が現れ、世襲化されて学問としては停滞が見られた公家や武家の有職故実の伝統に囚われない独自の研究が見られた。
sen.e: In and after the Edo period, researchers of Yusoku kojitsu emerged among ordinary citizens along with development of the study of classical literature, and made original studies free from traditions of kuge and buke Yusoku kojitsu, which showed stagnation as academics because they were transferred by heredity.

sen.j: 河内国の壺井義知は民間の出ながら、官職・装束の研究においては当代随一とされて、公家さえもが教えを乞うたと言われている。
sen.e: Although Yoshichika TSUBOI in the Kawachi Province was an ordinary citizen, he was considered the greatest of the day in the research of job grades and Shozoku (costumes), and it is said even kuge sat at his feet.

sen.j: 公家達の側でも壺井に触発されるかのように、野宮定基・滋野井公麗・裏松光世（裏松固禅）らによってその学問的水準が高められるようになった。
sen.e: On the kuge side, as if they were inspired by Tsuboi, the academic level was increased by Sadamoto NONOMIYA, Kinkazu SHIGENOI, Mitsuyo URAMATSU (Kozen URAMATSU) and others.

sen.j: 武家側でも田安宗武・松平定信・塙保己一などが研究家として知られている。
sen.e: On the buke side, Munetake TAYASU, Sadanobu MATSUDAIRA, Hokiichi HANAWA, etc. are known as researchers.

sen.j: 武家故実についても、江戸時代の武家故実の第一人者とされる伊勢貞丈（伊勢氏一族）が多数の著作を著わしたほか、『本朝軍器考』を著わした新井白石・榊原長俊（伊勢貞丈の弟子）・中山信名（塙保己一の弟子）などが研究家として知られている。
sen.e: For buke-kojitsu, Sadatake ISE (the Ise clan), who is said to be a leading expert in the Edo period, wrote many books, and Hakuseki ARAI who wrote "Honcho Gunkiko" (a review and classification on historical weapons), Nagatoshi SAKAKIBARA (a disciple of Sadatake ISE), and Nobuna NAKAYAMA (a disciple of Hokiichi HANAWA), etc. are known as researchers.

Within the field of buke-kojitsu, in addition to Sadatake ISE (the Ise clan), who is said to be a leading figure of Edo period buke kojitsu and who wrote many books, other renowned researchers include Hakuseki ARAI who wrote "Honcho Gunkiko" (a review and classification on historical weapons), Nagatoshi SAKAKIBARA (a disciple of Sadatake ISE), and Nobuna NAKAYAMA (a disciple of Hokiichi HANAWA).

sen.j: 近代に入ると、旧来の公家・武家制度の廃止によって実用的な意味での有識故実研究の歴史に幕を閉じた。
sen.e: In modern times, the history of Yusoku kojitsu study in a practical sense ended as the conventional kuge and buke system was abolished.

sen.j: また、官制などの研究は法制史の一部となった。
sen.e: In addition, study of governmental regulations was included in the legal history.

sen.j: それでも歴史学の一環、あるいは日本文学研究の一環として研究が行われ続け、佐藤誠実・和田英松などの優れた研究家を輩出した。
sen.e: Even so, studies continued as part of history or study on Japanese literature, and excellent researchers such as Jojitsu SATO and Hidematsu WADA appeared one after another.
